conclusion: The question involves four objects casting shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
There are four objects above the slabs casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.
When the light source is directly above the objects, the shadows will be directly below the objects.
Since the light source is moving to the right, the shadows will move to the left to maintain their position directly below the objects.
As the light source moves further away from the objects, the shadows will become smaller because the light source is further away and the angle of the light is less steep.
The final answer is A, B, C, and D will all move to the left and become smaller.
